intro: Serrafalcus cavanillesii, commonly known as the Cavanilles' serra, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
